parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of airbags to deploy in the event of a crash can lead to serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: None of the frontal airbags deployed
passenger side airbag failed to deploy
driver's side airbag failed to deploy
side airbags did not respond
airbag warning light illuminated.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Erroneous airbag deployment can cause injuries, accidents, or distractions while driving.
symptoms: Airbag deployed without warning
passenger side airbag deployed erroneously
driver's side airbag deployed without incident
airbag warning light illuminated.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Airbag system malfunction can lead to failure of airbags to deploy in the event of a crash or erroneous deployment, causing injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: Airbag warning light comes on
airbag light blinks on and off
airbag light remains on
airbag system malfunction
faulty airbags.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the master cylinder can cause the brake pedal to go to the floor, leading to a loss of braking ability, which can result in accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The brake pedal feels soft or spongy
the brake pedal goes to the floor
the vehicle shakes or vibrates when applying the brakes
the brakes pulsate or grab
the vehicle takes longer to stop than usual.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Warped brake rotors can cause the vehicle to vibrate or shake when applying the brakes, leading to a loss of control and potential accidents.
symptoms: The vehicle vibrates or shakes when applying the brakes
the brake pedal pulsates or grabs
the rotors need to be resurfaced frequently.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Faulty brake pads can cause the brakes to fail, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The brakes squeak or make noise
the brake pads wear out prematurely
the brake pedal feels soft or spongy.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: An electrical system failure can cause the brakes to fail, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The vehicle loses all electrical functions
the brakes fail to operate
the vehicle experiences multiple problems simultaneously.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A design issue with the brake pedal can cause the foot to fall between the brake and gas pedals, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The distance between the gas and brake pedals is too small
the foot can fall between the pedals.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure of the rear brakes can cause the vehicle to lose control, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The rear brakes fail to operate
the vehicle loses control
the rear brake pads wear out prematurely.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the steering system can cause the vehicle to lose control, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: The steering wheel pulls to one side
the vehicle veers from left to right
the steering wheel is difficult to turn
the steering wheel makes a loud banging noise
the vehicle is hard to control on the interstate
the vehicle is hard to control on side streets/main roads
the vehicle has a tendency to lose control when driving over bumps
the steering wheel has a sudden loss of power
the steering wheel has a delayed return to its normal position.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ball joints can cause the vehicle to lose control, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: The ball joints snap
the vehicle falls to the ground
the steering and suspension are almost impossible to control
the vehicle is extremely hard to control and stay in lanes.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the tie rods can cause the vehicle to lose control, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: The tie rod breaks
the tie rod end needs to be replaced
the tie rod falls to the ground
the tie rod is rusted and pitted.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Front Suspension Failure (Upper and Lower Ball Joints, Control Arms, and A-Frames)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the front suspension components can cause the vehicle to lose control, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities. The detachment of the ball joints, control arms, or A-frames can also result in loss of steering, making it difficult to maneuver the vehicle.
symptoms: Abnormal sounds (squealing
clunking
or grinding) from the front of the vehicle
vibration
shaking
or wobbling of the steering wheel
loss of steering control
vehicle pulling to one side
or sudden collapse of the front suspension.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the coil spring can cause the vehicle to lose control, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities. The sudden loss of tire pressure can result in loss of traction, making it difficult to control the vehicle.
symptoms: Loud popping or banging noise
sudden loss of tire pressure
vehicle pulling to one side
or loss of control.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The misalignment of the rear suspension can cause the vehicle to lose control, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities. The vehicle may drift or pull to one side, making it difficult to maintain control.
symptoms: Vehicle drifting or pulling to one side
uneven tire wear
or abnormal noises from the rear of the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Heater core failure can cause the vehicle to overheat, leading to a loss of visibility due to steam or fog on the windshield, which can increase the risk of accidents. It can also cause coolant to drain onto the floor of the vehicle, potentially leading to electrical system failures.
symptoms: Smoke emits from the air vents
the vehicle overheats
coolant drains onto the floor of the vehicle
vapor and odor from the engine coolant leak through the vents
and an oil-like substance coats the windshield.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Windshield wiper failure can reduce visibility during heavy rain or snow, increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: Windshield wipers fail to operate during heavy rain or snow
windshield wipers come on for no reason
and the windshield becomes inoperable in heavy rain storms.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Windshield adhesive failure can cause the windshield to become loose or detached, reducing visibility and increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: The windshield slips down
the windshield leaks
and the windshield vibrates when the door is closed.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Rear view mirror failure can reduce visibility, increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: The rear view mirror pops out of the mount
the rear view mirror shakes excessively
and the rear view mirror is inoperable.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Defroster system failure can reduce visibility, increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: The defroster system does not function properly in adverse weather
the vents are not directed correctly
and the windows do not get cleared.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Sunroof and windshield design issues can cause distractions, reduce visibility, and increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: Wind roar at sunroof when open or closed
extreme and excessive hot air is dispensed from the side window demisters
and reflections of the dashboard components and street lights cause poor visibility.
